title: nullama
author: nullama
content: Jon Collins-Black, a web entrepreneur and early Bitcoin investor, made his fortune by selling a website and hodling his Bitcoin from the early days.He wrote a book, There's Treasure Inside, which contain all the instructions and hints required to get the loot.Quote from: https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/jon-collins-black-treasure-hunt-book-bitcoin-b2663044.htmlCollins-Black commissioned five unique puzzle boxes, which have been scattered across the United States, four of similar sizes and then one larger box containing the lion’s share of the fortune.Quote from: https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/jon-collins-black-treasure-hunt-book-bitcoin-b2663044.html“We’re in a digital world and what I’ve put together is an analog adventure,” he says of his new book There’s Treasure Inside. “All you need is a book, some water and some shoes.”The treasure contains one of the physical Bitcoins by Casascius.So, why did this guy do this? Just for fun!Quote from: https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/jon-collins-black-treasure-hunt-book-bitcoin-b2663044.html“At the end of the day, there’s value to the excitement and the joy of the experience,” he says. “That sounds like cliché but for me, when I was searching for Forrest Fenn’s treasure, it was the idea of it that was most exciting. If I had found the treasure it would have been euphoric, but I don't know if it would have exceeded the total joy that I had just through the whole process of it.”

comments.author: john_egbert
comments.body: That sounds and resembles a Cipher hunt for me - an ARG of sorts.And that's a wonderful thing if it's done properly. Different things blend in to create an adventure worth remembering.There are relics of the old, an Olympian medal, and there also should of been something from Einstein, but Jon lost it in a bidding war   ( source ).Interesting to see what would be in the biggest chest.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: It seems like a good scenario for an adventure series that could become very popular in our time, based on the idea related to Bitcoin and other values that are interesting to humanity. However, in his book, Bitcoin looks like something material; if you read the announcement, it talks about objects. Certainly, today's price for his book is quite symbolic money, but the idea could be interesting for many directors.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: That's a great way to advertise your book and increase your sales. He will get all sorts of people buying it now. With a good marketing plan and well-placed ads, he might earn more than the value of the treasures in the end. I am sure that all kind of adventurers and puzzle lovers will line up and go on a hunt, both for the thrill of it and expecting a huge payday.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Maybe all this was a strategy to promote his book, just think about it, for sure a lot of people will buy it to find the different hints and try to solve the puzzle. comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: nullama on December 16, 2024, 06:53:29 AMSo, why did this guy do this? Just for fun!This author has actually been playing with this idea a few years ago. Even during the pandemic, he was already launching a project to have people treasure hunt. But we have to realize that this kind of project requires time and effort which is why it is only now that he got to launch a project as big as this was. The reason why bitcoin was along the items to be hunted is so that different kinds of people will find something they are interested in and participate in the treasure hunt.These are what said to be in the stash: A fourth-century BCE gold Greek laurel, A coin designed and minted by Pablo Picasso, A rare lunar rock specimen, A Michael Jordan 1986 rookie card and the bitcoin of course. It is really interesting and I am quite excited to see who would find these items.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: You have to admit that the man has come up with a good strategy to promote his book, while also having a good time watching people search for his hidden treasure. However, this is something only for those who live in the US or who would be willing to travel there to try their luck at treasure hunting - the rest of us can only observe and wish luck to those who will start their search.I remember that an older member of this forum hid something similar (paper wallets) around the world and that he even published it on the forum. It was a long time ago and I don't remember the exact name - I just remember that he had an avatar of a man holding a bow and arrow in the company of some natives.
